alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 4:40AM AKST until December 27 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Freezing rain with significant icing possible. Total ice accumulations of up to one quarter inch possible. * WHERE...Anchorage. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Travel could be extremely hazardous. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel on Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will develop late Saturday night and transition to freezing rain Sunday morning. The heaviest precipitation is expected Sunday afternoon, though there is a good chance that temperatures across part of Anchorage will rise above freezing. The typically colder areas of east Anchorage and Eagle River are likely to hold on to sub-freezing temperatures and freezing rain, so will likely see the most ice accumulation.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
